member.name: T:PLEXOS_NET.Database
member.summary: Database class provides functions to perform operation on PLEXOS input database.
member.remarks: Connection with PLEXOS database should be established first before calling any function from Database class.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.#ctor
member.exception: Unable to locate master file at [filepath]
member.remarks: Master.xml file is required to create a new instance of Database class.

member.name: P:PLEXOS_NET.Database.DisplayAlerts
member.summary: Flag to disable the alerts (message boxes)
member.returns: The DisplayAlerts property returns ture/false.
member.remarks: If this is true then exceptions will be thrown rather than a message box being displayed. Default value is true.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.Connection(System.String)
member.summary: Connection function establishes a connection with the PLEXOS database
member.param: PLEXOS database file path
member.remarks:
Connection function takes a string(filepath) that points to the PLEXOS database file and establishes a connection with the dataset.
Unable to locate the file 'filepath' error is prompted when PLEXOS database file is not found.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.Close
member.summary: Closes the Connection with the PLEXOS input database
member.remarks: This function cleans up the temporary files used by the API

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.NewEmptyDatabase(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an empty input PLEXOS database
member.exception: Invalid throws error : Destination directory does not exist
File already exists error is prompted if overwrite = false and PLEXOS database file already exist on the specified path.
Database connection not set. Please use the connection property to set this
member.param: The new database will be located at this filepath, filename must be included

The new database will override the exist file at this filepath if it is true, else return false if the file exists
Default value is False
member.returns: Return true if new database is created successfully
member.remarks: Connection with PLEXOS Database should be established before calling NewEmptyDatabase function.

member.name: P:PLEXOS_NET.Database.InstallPath
member.summary: Returns the installation path of PLEXOS
member.value: Returns PLEXOS installation path as string value.
member.returns: The InstallPath property returns PLEXOS installation path.
member.remarks:
The InstallPath property is read only.
In case of multiple versions of PLEXOS installation, it returns the path of PLEXOS installation from which the API is being referenced.

member.name: P:PLEXOS_NET.Database.PLEXOSVersion
member.summary: Returns the current version PLEXOS
member.returns: Returns the current version of the PLEXOS API, formatted in the style: 8.200 R01

member.name: P:PLEXOS_NET.Database.PLEXOSBuildDate
member.summary: Retrieve the date that the PLEXOS API was built
member.returns: Returns the build date of the PLEXOS API, formatted as: yyyy-mm-dd

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.GetData(System.String,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Gets the data of the specified data table (in recordset form) from PLEXOS database
member.exception: "Cannot remove this column, because it is a part of the constraint Constraint3 on the table [table_name]." exception is prompted when a column is not allowed to be removed
If connection is not established before calling a function then following error is thrown: Database connection not set. Please use the connection property to set this
member.param: The name of the table in PLEXOS database e.g. t_object
List of column names that will be removed from the returned data
member.returns: Returns data table(as recordset) excluding columns specified in the parameter
member.remarks:
'Transform.xsl' file should exist in the same directory where PLEXOS API is located.
Connection with PLEXOS Database should be established before calling GetData function.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.AddCustomColumn(PLEXOS_NET.Enums.ClassEnum,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a Custom Column to the specified Class Enum in PLEXOS database
member.exception: If connection is not established before calling a function then following error is thrown: Database connection not set. Please use the connection property to set this
member.param: The Class Enum e.g. ClassEnum.Generator
The name of the column to be added
The Object name that belongs to the specified Class enum e.g. Generator1
The data for the Custom Column
member.returns:
Returns true is the column is successfully added and returns false if fails to add column.
AddCustomColumn function will return false if the Objectname does not exist, but it will add Custom Column in PLEXOS database.
member.remarks:
Note: The column name would be added at the bottom of the list of Custom Columns.
Connection with PLEXOS Database should be established before calling AddCustomColumn function.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.AppendCustomColumnData(PLEXOS_NET.Enums.ClassEnum,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Appends data to existing Custom Column in PLEXOS database
member.exception: If connection is not established before calling a function then following error is thrown: Database connection not set. Please use the connection property to set this
member.param: The Class Enum e.g. ClassEnum.Generator
The Custom Column name
The Object name e.g. Generator1
The Custom Column data
member.returns: Returns true is data is appended successfully and false in case of failure
member.remarks:
Note that the Custom Column data is nullable.
Connection with PLEXOS Database should be established before calling AppendCustomColumn function.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.RemoveCustomColumn(PLEXOS_NET.Enums.ClassEnum,System.String)
member.summary: Removes Custom Column and the data attached to it from PLEXOS database
member.exception: If connection is not established before calling a function then following error is thrown: Database connection not set. Please use the connection property to set this
member.param: The Class enum e.g ClassEnum.Generator
The name of the Custom Column
member.returns: Returns ture if the Custom Column is deleted successfully and false in case of failure
member.remarks:
Note that all data attached to the Custom Column will be deleted along with the specified Custom Column
Connection with PLEXOS Database should be established before calling RemoveCustomColumn function.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.Database.AddObject(System.String,PLEXOS_NET.Enums.ClassEnum,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a Object to PLEXOS database
member.exception: If connection is not established before calling a function then following error is thrown: Database connection not set. Please use the connection property to set this
member.param: The object name
The class id e.g. PLEXOS_NET.Enums.ClassEnum.Battery
True/False, Automatically creates the system membership if true
Category name, by default null
Text description for the new object, by default null
member.returns: This function returns 1
member.remarks:
A system membership must be created otherwise the dataset will not save.
Non-null, unique, or foreign key constraint violation error would be prompted if object already exist in PLEXOS database. Unable to locate the Category titled [Name] error is prompted if category is not found in PLEXOS database.
Connection with PLEXOS Database should be established before calling AddObject function.

member.name: M:PLEXOS_NET.PLEXOSConnect.Connection(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the connection string to PLEXOS Connect.
member.param: This is in a SQL format style, for example: Data Source=myServerAddress,port;User Id=myUsername;Password=myPassword;
member.remarks:
This can accept multiple formats:
HostName+IPv4 only: "Data Source=ServerAddress:port;User Id=myUsername;Password=myPassword;"
HostName+IPv4+IPv6: "Data Source=IPAddress,port;User Id=myUsername;Password=myPassword;"
IPv4+IPv6 : "Data Source=[IPAddress]:port;User Id=myUsername;Password=myPassword;"
